favorites.fact: 5 is the most common number of gears for automobiles with manual transmission.
5 is the second Sierpinski number of the first kind, and can be written as S2=(22)+1.
112 is the number of surat al-Ikhlas in the Qur'an.
1215 is the smallest number n where n and n+1 are both products of 6 or more primes.
10 is the aliquot sum of only one number the discrete semiprime 14.
4 is the number of movements in a symphony.

history.fact: Fact
5141 is the only four digit number that is reversed in hexadecimal.
5 is the second Sierpinski number of the first kind, and can be written as S2=(22)+1.
2 is the price in cents per acre the USA bought Alaska from Russia.
2 is many properties in mathematics.
1 is the first figurate number of every kind, such as triangular number, pentagonal number and centered hexagonal number, to name just a few.
2 is the number of polynucleotide strands in a DNA double helix.
2 is the first magic number in physics.
12 is the largest number that has just one syllable.
144 is the number of months in 12 years.
120 is the first multiply perfect number of order three (a 3-perfect number, triperfect).
82 is the twenty-third biprime and the twelfth of the form (2.q).
8223 is a number for which we're missing a fact (submit one to numbersapi at google mail!).
112 is the number of surat al-Ikhlas in the Qur'an.
725 is the year that Bede writes On the reckoning of time (De temporum ratione) explaining how to calculate medieval Easter.
5600 is the number of self-complementary graphs with 13 vertices.
103 is a strictly non-palindromic number.
10 is the aliquot sum of only one number the discrete semiprime 14.
1323 is a boring number.
122 is the smallest number n>1 so that n concatenated with n-1 0's concatenated with the reverse of n is prime.
123 is the 10^{th} Lucas number.
1283 is the number of ways to divide a 8Ã—8 grid of points into two sets using a straight line.
1273 is a boring number.
1423 is the number of digits in the 3^{rd} Cullen prime.
1463 is a boring number.
173 is a square-free number, divisible by no perfect square.
13 is the number of Archimedian solids.
903 is the 6^{th} super Catalan number.
43 is a centered heptagonal number.
7973 is a number for which we're missing a fact (submit one to numbersapi at google mail!).
5 is the number of appendages on most starfish, which exhibit pentamerism.
5 is the number of babies born in a quintuplet.
5 is the number of basic tastes (sweet, salty, sour, bitter, and umami).
529 is the smallest number n so that the continued fraction for n/k contains no 2's for any 1 = k = n.
2 is the only number x such that the sum of the reciprocals of the powers of x equals itself.
7522 is an uninteresting number.
32 is the ninth happy number.
422 is the smallest number whose 8^{th} power has 21 digits.
4 is the number of movements in a symphony.
5 is the holy number of Discordianism, as dictated by the Law of Fives.
December 15th is the day in 1976 that Samoa becomes a member of the United Nations.
41 BC is the year that Lucius Antonius occupied Perusia, he accepted the appeal of the local population.
453 is the only number n so that n, 2n, and 6n together contain every digit exactly once.
650000000 is the number of years that jellyfish have been on Earth, existing before sharks and dinosaurs.
